artifacts.label: Soup Protocol Documentation
artifacts.blurb: The Soup docs are styled like a digital whitepaper. A good introduction sets the stage, emphasizes benefits, and uses diagrams to establish the scope and introduce the cast of characters.

artifacts.label: FOMO App - Live Market
artifacts.blurb: A mobile prediction market interface showing live betting on Eagles vs. Chiefs. Displays real-time odds, volume, and cash-out options.

artifacts.label: Single Market View
artifacts.blurb: Prediction markets are a natural fit for social apps like Base. Combined with live sports updates and the chatter from your social graph, this is the screen you want open when you’re watching the Super Bowl.

artifacts.label: Receipt Detail
artifacts.blurb: The receipt is the most screen-shotted and most shared element of prediction markets. Here, the background gradient is derived from the position and originating client, in this case “Yes, Eagles” (teal) and Coinbase (blue).

artifacts.label: Clearing Co. Price Tag
artifacts.blurb: Permissionless market creation enables niche, long-tail markets like a bazaar or bodega full of hitherto unpriced curiosities. In prediction markets where price equals probability, 99¢ is the price of sure bet.

artifacts.label: Battleship Grid
artifacts.blurb: When prediction market mechanics are onchain, open building blocks, novel use cases are unlocked. In this imagined case, one side of a game of Battleship is played by the crowd, betting on the likelihood of a hit in any square on the grid. Hit/miss is revealed periodically on the square with the highest volume.
